emailer module¶

Description:

A set of utilities to allow for sending emails with attachments easily through SMTP.

Testing:

If you are testing the file assumes you’re calling from root directory (..), to test call the file by cd’ing out one directory and using: python utilities/emailer.py

Example

from emailer import send_mail() or for testing $ python utilities/emailer.py

emailer.configure_attachment(attachment_path)¶

A helper function for send_mail that properly configures attachments for sending :param attachment_path: A string with path of an attachment :type attachment_path: str

Returns

Properly formatted dictionary of attachments for use with yagmail

Return type

Dict[str, str]

emailer.import_smtp_from_json(path, test=False)¶

A helper function to set the SMTP configuration for send_email from a json file :param test: Indicates whether this is just a test run (True), or (False) in prod :type test: bool :param path: The path to the smtp configuration json file :type path: str

Returns

A tuple of configuration values (email to send from, smtp domain/host, port, recipients)

Return type

Tuple[str,str,str,str]

emailer.send_email(smtp_config_path='', subject='A test email from the emailer file', message='Hello World! \nI am a test email!', attachment='configuration\\test\\sema.png', test=False)¶

Function to send email based on configuration provided in JSON file :param smtp_config_path: Path to the SMTP configuration JSON file :type smtp_config_path: str :param message: The body of the email, accepts inline HTML or string formatting :type message: str :param attachment: Path to attachment, keep in mind this must have an extension :type attachment: str :param test: Indicates whether this is just a test run (True), or (False) in prod :type test: bool

Returns

True if email is sent without issues, if there is an issue returns False and logs+prints error

Return type

bool
